title: 114_s2125
content: The Act titled "Small Business Lending and Economic Inequality Reduction Act of 2015" also includes a section on the Community Advantage Program. The Small Business Act is amended to include a Community Advantage Program for eligible institutions like development companies and nonprofit intermediaries. The Small Business Act is amended to include a Community Advantage Program for eligible institutions like development companies and nonprofit intermediaries, including non-Federally regulated entities certified as community development financial institutions or other approved nonprofit organizations. The Small Business Act is amended to define terms such as Reservist, service-connected, and small business concern in an underserved market, which includes businesses located in low- or moderate-income communities, HUBZones, or other underserved areas. The Small Business Act is amended to include criteria for businesses eligible for the Community Advantage Program, such as being located in empowerment zones or enterprise communities, having over 50% of employees from low- or moderate-income areas, and being in operation for less than 2 years. The Advantage Program is for businesses owned and controlled by veterans, service-disabled veterans, or individuals with military affiliations, reservists, or spouses of veterans. The Community Advantage Program guarantees loans for small businesses in underserved markets, with a focus on veterans, members of the Armed Forces, Reservists, and surviving spouses of veterans. At least 60 percent of loans must be made to eligible businesses. Loans made under the program shall consist of loans to small businesses in underserved markets, with a maximum loan amount of $350,000. The Administrator will promulgate regulations within 1 year to carry out the program, similar to the Community Advantage Pilot Program. The Administrator may not continue the Community Advantage Pilot Program once new regulations are in effect. Amendments are made to the Small Business Act regarding covered institutions. Amendments are made to the Small Business Act regarding covered institutions, including the definition of a business concern and the exclusion of covered institutions as defined in section 7(a)(35)(A). SEC. 3 of the Federal Home Loan Bank Act is amended to include community development financial institutions in the purposes of advances and collateral available to covered institutions.
